results.content: The instructor sounded like a digital voice and was difficult to understand.  The lessons were sped through and not enough time to code along with the lesson.  Course material was out of date and the last "project" could not be completed because GOOGLE no longer allows automated queries.  I learned a couple of new things and like most of the courses I have taken from here it was worth the 9.99 I paid for it but would not have been worth paying full price for.

results.content: A course I keep coming back to when I have the time, to practice different aspects of the HTTP basics. AJAX has a reputation of being an 'old' technology, that should be addressed in this course to show how the skills learned here are integrated into a programmer's repertoire.
results.content_html: A course I keep coming back to when I have the time, to practice different aspects of the HTTP basics. AJAX has a reputation of being an 'old' technology, that should be addressed in this course to show how the skills learned here are integrated into a programmer's repertoire.

results.content:
This is the best and most comprehensive ajax(json, xml) course in udemy. The instructor is really good at teaching, she gives step by step tutorials and line by line explanation, and she often refreshes our memory by mentioning the syntax and the things to be noticed. I think in real-life she is a also a teacher, a very good teacher. 
The real-world projects are simple but practical and useful, and in Q&A section she answers question responsively and well-explained. This course uses php as server, if you want to catch-up, follow along in project section you need to have a basic understaning on php, I actually didn't know php very well but by coding along I am able to make the project work. This is the course you cannot miss!!!

results.content: Nice short well organized lectures. Fun interesting class projects. Easy to follow. Well done.
